pageContext.claim: “And, you know, when you say ‘per capita,’ there's many per capitas. It's, like, per capita relative to what? But you can look at just about any category, and we're really at the top, meaning positive on a per capita basis, too. They've done a great job.”
pageContext.analysis: Per capita simply means "per person." Trump chafes whenever this metric is used instead of raw numbers for coronavirus tests in the United States -- but it's the correct metric to use in tracking an epidemic. Measuring cases per capita reveals key information such as how widely and quickly the virus is spreading. The U.S. numbers look much better in comparison to other countries in raw totals as opposed to per capita figures, which is probably why Trump emphasizes the former.
